titlestmt.titleproper: Guide to the American Federation of State, County and Municipal Employees (AFSCME), District Council 37 Films FILMS.010
titlestmt.author: Bonnie Gordon

publicationstmt.publisher: Tamiment Library and Robert F. Wagner Labor Archives

profiledesc.creation: This finding aid was produced using ArchivesSpace on 2020-11-30 13:11:44 -0500.

repository.corpname: Tamiment Library and Robert F. Wagner Labor Archives

did.unittitle: American Federation of State, County and Municipal Employees (AFSCME), District Council 37 Films

acqinfo.head: Immediate Source of Acquisition
acqinfo.p: Materials in this collection were separated from American Federation of State, County, and Municipal Employees (AFSCME), District Council 37 Records (WAG 265) by Tamiment staff. The accession number associated with these materials is 2010.009.
The original gift was donated by the American Federation of State, County and Municipal Employees (AFSCME), District Council 37, in 2007.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Content Note
scopecontent.p: Six 100-ft. (or about 3-minutes each) reels of 16mm black and white reversal film Kodak Plus-X Reversal Movie Film (7276). The reels are inside individual metal film cans which are inside individual cardboard film boxes. There is no date and no identification other than the name "Al Weil" written on the boxes holding the reels. In addition, each box has a number written on it in grease pencil, from 1 to 6. It is not clear whether these are duplicates of one another, or possibly reels from the same shoot. The "develop before" date (e.g., "develop before [date]") stamped on the boxes is May 1964, so it is possible that the film was shot before May 1964 (and probably after 1955, when this film stock was introduced by Kodak).

phystech.head: Audiovisual Access Policies and Procedures
phystech.p: Audiovisual materials have not been preserved and may not be available to researchers. Materials not yet digitized will need to have access copies made before they can be used. To request an access copy, or if you are unsure if an item has been digitized, please contact tamiment.wagner@nyu.edu, (212) 998-2630 with the collection name, collection number, and a description of the item(s) requested. A staff member will respond to you with further information.

prefercite.head: Preferred Citation
prefercite.p: Identification of item, date; American Federation of State, County and Municipal Employees (AFSCME), District Council 37 Films; FILMS 010; box number; folder number; Tamiment Library/Robert F. Wagner Labor Archives, New York University.

userestrict.head: Conditions Governing Use
userestrict.p: Any rights (including copyright and related rights to publicity and privacy) held by AFSCME District Council 37 were transferred to New York University in 2007 by AFSCME District Council 37. Permission to publish or reproduce materials in this collection must be secured from Tamiment Library and Robert F. Wagner Archives. Please contact tamiment.wagner@nyu.edu, (212) 998-2630.
